snippet: As Congress begins debating an overhaul of immigration, many sense that the country is beginning the same evolution California experienced over the last two decades.
abstract: Many Californians, as Congress begins debating an overhaul of immigration, sense that country is following same evolution their state has experienced over last two decades; state party leaders from both sides are calling for softer approach to immigration and wholesale change in federal policies; changing attitudes are driven, in large part, by growing Hispanic population.
lead_paragraph: As Congress begins debating an overhaul of immigration, many sense that the country is beginning the same evolution California experienced over the last two decades.

headline.seo: California Eases Its Tone as Latinos Make Gains
headline.main: California Eases Tone as Latinos Make Gains
headline.print_headline: California Eases Tone As Latinos Make Gains
